pr_title: Add tests to the KafkaStreams quickstart

timeline.bodyText: Would be good to add a timeout, in case the records never materialize. I think Awaitility is used in similar situations already in other tests.
timeline.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText:
There's actually a JUnit timeout (10s) at test level, could it be enough ?
I guess a failure could be clearer with Awaitility, but I've only used it for async calls, not sure what's the pattern for a while loop ?
replies.author: rquinio

replies.bodyText:
There's actually a JUnit timeout (10s) at test level, could it be enough ?

Ah yes, I see.

not sure what's the pattern for a while loop ?

Here's how we use it in Debezium: https://github.com/debezium/debezium-examples/blob/master/testcontainers/src/test/java/io/debezium/examples/testcontainers/DebeziumContainerTest.java#L134-L148
Leaving it to you which way to go.
replies.author: gunnarmorling

timeline.bodyText: Also assert the station name so to see the joining works?
